title: Partnership Restructuring + Agentic AI
summary: Restructured $135B partnership, Azure exclusivity until AGI, 800M+ weekly ChatGPT users, Agent 365 suite

content.whatItIs: The foundational AI partnership that ignited the AI boom, now restructured with clearer boundaries. OpenAI focuses on frontier models while Microsoft deploys at enterprise scale through Agent 365 and Azure.
howItWorks: New MOU signed: Microsoft holds ~$135B investment (27% as-converted diluted basis)
OpenAI remains Microsoft's frontier model partner with Azure API exclusivity until AGI
OpenAI committed to $250B additional Azure cloud services
Microsoft sole cloud provider allowed to sell OpenAI models until at least 2030
OpenAI transitioning to public benefit corporation (PBC) with Microsoft support
2026 focus: 'Agentic AI' with Microsoft's Agent 365 suite—autonomous digital workers for procurement, HR, supply chain
content.coreInsight: CFO Sarah Friar: 2026 is the year of 'practical adoption'—closing the gap between what AI makes possible and how people use it daily. Focus on health, science, and enterprise.
content.keyMetrics: ChatGPT: 800M+ weekly active users, 1M+ business customers. OpenAI revenue: $2B (2023) to $20B+ (2025). Compute grew from 0.2GW to 1.9GW. Vision: ChatGPT evolving from chatbot to 'super assistant' with goals, context, and proactive help.

extendedContent.partnershipTensions: Partnership frayed under pressure in 2025 as the halcyon early days ended. FTC and European Commission actively investigating for potential anti-competitive behavior. Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella wants industry to stop calling AI 'slop.' OpenAI reportedly burning through vast cash to maintain AI advances—some project $14B losses in 2026 and potential bankruptcy by 2027.
